definition: to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to lend an arm to support sb
to dilute/to debase (by mixing with fake material)

sentences.english: Objective To research whether pangolin adulterated with magnesium sulfate can goods after lavation.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究攙硫酸鎂穿山甲洗滌後是否能作穿山甲入藥。

sentences.english: The first angel sounded his trumpet, and there came hail and fire mixed with blood, and it was hurled down upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 第一位天使吹號，就有雹子與火攙着血丟在地上。

sentences.english: I handed him into his car.
Just then an old man entered, supported by a boy.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時候，一個男孩攙着一位老大爺走了進來。

sentences.english: Steerforth was holding my arm and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 斯提福茲嘻笑着攙着我的胳膊。

sentences.english: Niang favour came forward Chan too madam.
sentences.chinese: 十一娘忙上前攙了太夫人。

sentences.english: Someone had been watering the milk.
After the first trumpet came hail and fire mixed with blood.
sentences.chinese: 第一號帶來雹子與火攙着血。

sentences.english: But ignorance, mingled with the human paste, blackens it.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在做人的麪糊裏攙上無知，它便變成黑的。

sentences.english: So I said thanks, I'd have a highball .
sentences.chinese: 我說，謝謝，我有一杯攙薑汁啤酒的威士忌。

sentences.english: Jack hands Cheryl to the bedroom and helps her lie down her back on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 傑克把謝麗爾扶進臥室，攙着她上了牀。

sentences.english: He add sand to the soil to make it more porous.
sentences.chinese: 他往土裏攙沙子以提高滲水性能。

definition: to slander/to defame/to misrepresent/to speak maliciously
lots (to be drawn)/lot (in a game of chance)
